City reacts after tragedy on Boylston Street

Jacqueline Myers (right) and her daughter, Amira, left a teddy bear on the porch of victim Martin Richard’s home. Brian Snyder/Reuters
A guardsman checked identification at a roadblock near the crime scene. Spencer Platt/Getty Images
Bags of belongings were sorted out near the Boston Marathon's finish line. Justin Lane/EPA
A pedestrian walked past abandoned tables at Stephanie's on Newbury this morning. Matthew Cavanaugh/EPA
The front page of today's Chicago Tribune sports section paid tribute to Boston's sports teams.
MIT's Green Building was illuminated with an image of the American flag overnight. Matthew J. Lee / Globe Staff
Authorities searched an apartment complex overnight on Revere Beach Parkway as part of the investigation. Matthew J. Lee / Globe Staff
Law enforcement officials are seen leaving the apartment complex in Revere, which is a part of the investigation. Getty Images
Boston.com Steve Silva caught the blast and immediate aftermath of the blast. Steve Silva/Boston.com
Armed police officers secured the main entrance to Bringham and Women's Hospital. Getty Images
Medical workers aided injured people at the finish line of the 2013 Boston Marathon following an explosion in Boston. Charles Krupa/AP
A Boston police officer carried a young boy outside of the Forum restaurant on Boylston Street. Bill Hoenk for the Boston Globe
People injured during the bombing were brought to Boston Medical Center. Pat Greenhouse/Globe Staff
"Stay strong, Boston! Our prayers are with you"
— Sam, Gales Ferry, Conn.
